intro: Talauma irwiniana, commonly known as the Irwin's talauma, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in humid, shaded environments and thrives in the undergrowth of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
